instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.HALL_SENSOR_LEFT: What is HALL_SENSOR_LEFT? HALL_SENSOR_LEFT is a signal from the hall sensor on the left side of the machine that indicates that the lid has been closed. This is necessary for setting SMC_LID properly so the machine knows whether it is closed or open. When this is low, the machine will think it is closed which may cause it to go to sleep or have no backlight on the screen.
definitions.SMC_LID_RIGHT: What is SMC_LID_RIGHT? SMC_LID_RIGHT is a signal that tells the system if the lid is closed from the right LID sensor. If it is low, the system thinks the lid is closed – if it is 3.3v, the system thinks the machine is open. SMC_LID_RIGHT needs to be high for the machine to stay awake and have a backlight. .
definitions.SMC_LID_LEFT: What is SMC_LID_LEFT? SMC_LID_LEFT is a signal that tells the system if the lid is closed from the left LID sensor. If it is low, the system thinks the lid is closed – if it is 3.3v, the system thinks the machine is open. SMC_LID_LEFT needs to be high for the machine to stay awake and have a backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> runs from battery but not boots
threads.message:
I got this one very badly damaged near keyboard and speacker area (J6603 and J4801). Not liquid damage, just some "friend-tecnichian" tried to repair it. Computer wasn't booting due short (<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> on J4810). Found it, replaced both connector, now it starts and work normal untill u sleep it. After that image desappear. I can still clicking sound of up/down volume but here is no image ( can see it on external display, not always, sometimes image disappear on both displays)


The only way to boot it with his displays and working (untill sleep it again" is disconnect-connect battery and plug charger than i will start, and will charge the battery all will be ok. I also tried to just start from battery but it doesnt work too. 


Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> runs from battery but not boots
threads.message: Board doesn't even try to start with battery only?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> runs from battery but not boots
threads.message: No, nothing happens. But board sees battery, Charges it and works from it until sleep or shut downs. After that image disappear but computer still working

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> runs from battery but not boots
threads.message:
Seems that we do not understand.
I didn' ask if board boots on battery only.
I asked if starts.
A board turned on is not the same as working board.
I suppose it turns on in your case, but I wanted to confirm that.

START and BOOT are different things!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> runs from battery but not boots
threads.message: you mean if it enteres in S0 mode ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> runs from battery but not boots
threads.message:
A board starts power sequence even if stuck in S3.
We usually say the board doesn't start if stuck in S5.
But sometime we get confused about starting and working boards.

A board can go to S0, but not always working.
So need to describe exact state of the board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> runs from battery but not boots
threads.message:
Well, sorry for delay. I was working on that board and finally it is running from battery. It was keyboard issue. The only issue is now remains is image problem. 

I start from battery login in to systems and close notebook. After wake up for first moments it is just backlight issue and i can see display without light. But in few seconds it completly shuts down ( display, computer is still working fine).  display issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> runs from battery but not boots
threads.message:
Both image and backlight go off?
You can have problem with Hall sensors...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> runs from battery but not boots
threads.message:
yes. Display is ok because i have new displays and happenning same thing. 

Playing with external monitor sometimes closing/opnening and disconnecting external monitor image appear but never backlight. 


Will check now that sensor. Thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> runs from battery but not boots
threads.message:
I checked <CHIP>U5255</CHIP> and near components but nothing unusual is there. How that circuit works? when you close then open cover it sends signal through <CHIP>U5255</CHIP> and tells display to power on? 


it's almost impossible to measer <SIGNAL>HALL_SENSOR_LEFT</SIGNAL>  and RIGHT because it is on other side of the board and can't see any test point on other side.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> runs from battery but not boots
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>LID_OPEN</SIGNAL> is 3.4 when open and 0 when close, doesnt matter how money time i close and opne it. Cant find the way to measure <SIGNAL>SMC_LID_RIGHT</SIGNAL> <SIGNAL>SMC_LID_LEFT</SIGNAL> 


may be smc issue?


P.S: ALso J5250 was bad and had been cleaned and now seems be ok.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> runs from battery but not boots
threads.message:
Sorry for few messages but i am checkind and can see that <SIGNAL>SMC_LID_RIGHT</SIGNAL> is very low 0.04 and <SIGNAL>SMC_LID_LEFT</SIGNAL> is 3.3V. 


P.S. Solved. I followed right signal way and get to J5250 and changed flex. Now it is working fine. If any changes be sure i will back:D


Thanks again informaticos.
